center.p:
H. R. 668To amend section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, to require that annual budget submissions of the President to Congress provide an estimate of the cost per taxpayer of the deficit, and for other purposes.
IN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
February 13, 2013
Mr. MESSER (for himself, Mr. YOUNG of Indiana, and Mr. MULVANEY) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Budget
A BILLR. 668

body.p: To amend section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, to require that annual budget submissions of the President to Congress provide an estimate of the cost per taxpayer of the deficit, and for other purposes.

p.em: Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

body.h3: SECTION 1. REQUIREMENT IN BUDGET SUBMISSION WITH RESPECT TO THE COST PER TAXPAYER OF THE DEFICIT.

ul.p: Section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, is amended--
(1) redesignating paragraph (37) (relating to the list of outdated or duplicative plans and reports) as paragraph (39); and
(2) by adding at the end the following:

blockquote.p: ‘(40) in the case of a fiscal year in which the budget is projected to result in a deficit, an estimate of the pro rata cost of such deficit for taxpayers who will file individual income tax returns for taxable years ending during such fiscal year.’.

inserted.p: Passed the House of Representatives March 5, 2013.

To amend section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, to require that annual budget submissions of the President to Congress provide an estimate of the cost per taxpayer of the deficit, and for other purposes.
